00352           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) && ((offset <= 1))) ||
00353           (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX) && ((offset <= 1)))))
00354         cvmx_warn("CVMX_MIXX_TSTAMP(%lu) is invalid on this chip\n", offset);
00355     return CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001070000100060ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 2048;
00356 }
00357 #else
00358 #define CVMX_MIXX_TSTAMP(offset) (CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(0x0001070000100060ull) + ((offset) & 1) * 2048)
00359 #endif
00360 
00361 /**
00362  * cvmx_mix#_bist
00363  *
00364  * This register contains the BIST status for the MIX memories: 0 = pass or never run, 1 = fail.
00365  *
00366  */
00367 union cvmx_mixx_bist {
00368     uint64_t u64;
00369     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s {
00370 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00371     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
00372     uint64_t opfdat                       : 1;  /**< BIST results for AGO OPF buffer RAM. */
00373     uint64_t mrgdat                       : 1;  /**< BIST results for AGI MRG buffer RAM. */
00374     uint64_t mrqdat                       : 1;  /**< BIST results for NBR CSR RDREQ RAM. */
00375     uint64_t ipfdat                       : 1;  /**< BIST results for MIX inbound packet RAM. */
00376     uint64_t irfdat                       : 1;  /**< BIST results for MIX I-Ring entry RAM. */
00377     uint64_t orfdat                       : 1;  /**< BIST results for MIX O-Ring entry RAM. */
00378 #else
00379     uint64_t orfdat                       : 1;
00380     uint64_t irfdat                       : 1;
00381     uint64_t ipfdat                       : 1;
00382     uint64_t mrqdat                       : 1;
00383     uint64_t mrgdat                       : 1;
00384     uint64_t opfdat                       : 1;
00385     uint64_t reserved_6_63                : 58;
00386 #endif
00387     } s;
00388     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_cn52xx {
00389 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00390     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
00391     uint64_t mrqdat                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for NBR CSR RdReq RAM
00392                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00393                                                          - 1: BAD */
00394     uint64_t ipfdat                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for MIX Inbound Packet RAM
00395                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00396                                                          - 1: BAD */
00397     uint64_t irfdat                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for MIX I-Ring Entry RAM
00398                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00399                                                          - 1: BAD */
00400     uint64_t orfdat                       : 1;  /**< Bist Results for MIX O-Ring Entry RAM
00401                                                          - 0: GOOD (or bist in progress/never run)
00402                                                          - 1: BAD */
00403 #else
00404     uint64_t orfdat                       : 1;
00405     uint64_t irfdat                       : 1;
00406     uint64_t ipfdat                       : 1;
00407     uint64_t mrqdat                       : 1;
00408     uint64_t reserved_4_63                : 60;
00409 #endif
00410     } cn52xx;
00411     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_cn52xx          cn52xxp1;
00412     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_cn52xx          cn56xx;
00413     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_cn52xx          cn56xxp1;
00414     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn61xx;
00415     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn63xx;
00416     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn63xxp1;
00417     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn66xx;
00418     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn68xx;
00419     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn68xxp1;
00420     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn73xx;
00421     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn78xx;
00422     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cn78xxp1;
00423     struct cvmx_mixx_bist_s               cnf75xx;
00424 };
00425 typedef union cvmx_mixx_bist cvmx_mixx_bist_t;

00427 /**
00428  * cvmx_mix#_ctl
00429  *
00430  * MIX_CTL = MIX Control Register
00431  *
00432  * Description:
00433  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_CTL register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
00434  *        To read the MIX_CTL register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
00435  */
00436 union cvmx_mixx_ctl {
00437     uint64_t u64;
00438     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s {
00439 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00440     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
00441     uint64_t ts_thresh                    : 4;  /**< TimeStamp interrupt threshold. When the number of pending Timestamp interrupts
00442                                                          (MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT]) is greater than
00443                                                          MIX(0..1)_CTL[TS_THRESH], then a programmable TimeStamp interrupt is issued (see
00444                                                          MIX(0..1)_INTR[TS]).
00445                                                          For CNXXXX, since the implementation only supports four outstanding timestamp interrupts,
00446                                                          this field should only be programmed from [0..3]. */
00447     uint64_t crc_strip                    : 1;  /**< Hardware CRC strip enable. When enabled, the last 4 bytes (CRC) of the ingress packet are
00448                                                          not included in cumulative packet byte length. In other words, the cumulative LEN field
00449                                                          for all I-Ring buffer entries associated with a given ingress packet will be 4 bytes less
00450                                                          (so that the final 4B hardware CRC packet data is not processed by software). */
00451     uint64_t busy                         : 1;  /**< MIX busy status bit. MIX asserts busy status any time there are:
00452                                                          * L2/DRAM read operations in-flight.
00453                                                          * L2/DRAM write operations in-flight.
00454                                                          After EN = 0, the MIX eventually completes any 'in-flight' transactions, at which point
00455                                                          the BUSY deasserts. */
00456     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< MIX enable bit. When [EN] = 0, MIX no longer arbitrates for any new L2/DRAM read/write
00457                                                          requests on the IOI. MIX completes any requests that are currently pending for the IOI. */
00458     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< MIX soft reset. When software writes a 1 to this field, the MIX logic executes a soft
00459                                                          reset.
00460                                                          During a soft reset, CSR accesses are not affected. However, the values of the fields are
00461                                                          affected by soft reset (except MIX(0..1)_CTL[RESET] itself).
00462                                                          After power-on, the MIX-BGX are held in reset until [RESET] is written to 0. Software must
00463                                                          also perform a MIX(0..1)_CTL CSR read after this write to ensure the soft reset
00464                                                          deassertion has had sufficient time to propagate to all MIO-MIX internal logic before
00465                                                          any subsequent MIX CSR accesses are issued.
00466                                                          The intended 'soft reset' sequence is:
00467                                                          * Write [EN] = 0 (to prevent any NEW transactions from being started).
00468                                                          * Wait for [BUSY] = 0 (to indicate that all in-flight transactions have completed).
00469                                                          * Write [RESET] = 1, followed by a MIX(0..1)_CTL register read and wait for the result.
00470                                                          * Re-initialize the MIX just as would be done for a hard reset.
00471                                                          Once the MIX has been soft-reset, please refer to MIX Bring-up Sequence, MIX Bring-up
00472                                                          Sequence to complete the MIX re-initialization sequence. */
00473     uint64_t lendian                      : 1;  /**< Packet little-endian mode enable.
00474                                                          When the mode is set, MIX byte-swaps packet data load/store operations at the MIX/IOB
00475                                                          boundary.
00476                                                          0 = Big-endian mode.
00477                                                          1 = Little-endian mode. */
00478     uint64_t nbtarb                       : 1;  /**< MIX CB-request arbitration mode. When cleared to 0, the arbiter is fixed priority with the
00479                                                          following priority scheme:
00480                                                          * I-Ring packet write request. (Highest Priority.)
00481                                                          * O-Ring packet read request.
00482                                                          * I-Ring entry write request.
00483                                                          * I-Ring entry read request.
00484                                                          * O-Ring entry read request.
00485                                                          When set to 1, the arbiter is round robin. */
00486     uint64_t mrq_hwm                      : 2;  /**< MIX CB-request FIFO programmable high watermark.
00487                                                          The MRQ contains 16 CB-requests which are CSR read/write requests. If the MRQ backs up
00488                                                          with HWM entries, then new CB-requests are stalled.
00489                                                          0x0 = HWM is 11.
00490                                                          0x1 = HWM is 10.
00491                                                          0x2 = HWM is 9.
00492                                                          0x3 = HWM is 8. */
00493 #else
00494     uint64_t mrq_hwm                      : 2;
00495     uint64_t nbtarb                       : 1;
00496     uint64_t lendian                      : 1;
00497     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
00498     uint64_t en                           : 1;
00499     uint64_t busy                         : 1;
00500     uint64_t crc_strip                    : 1;
00501     uint64_t ts_thresh                    : 4;
00502     uint64_t reserved_12_63               : 52;
00503 #endif
00504     } s;
00505     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_cn52xx {
00506 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00507     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00508     uint64_t crc_strip                    : 1;  /**< HW CRC Strip Enable
00509                                                          When enabled, the last 4 bytes(CRC) of the ingress packet
00510                                                          are not included in cumulative packet byte length.
00511                                                          In other words, the cumulative LEN field for all
00512                                                          I-Ring Buffer Entries associated with a given ingress
00513                                                          packet will be 4 bytes less (so that the final 4B HW CRC
00514                                                          packet data is not processed by software). */
00515     uint64_t busy                         : 1;  /**< MIX Busy Status bit
00516                                                          MIX will assert busy status any time there are:
00517                                                            1) L2/DRAM reads in-flight (NCB-arb to read
00518                                                               response)
00519                                                            2) L2/DRAM writes in-flight (NCB-arb to write
00520                                                               data is sent.
00521                                                            3) L2/DRAM write commits in-flight (NCB-arb to write
00522                                                               commit response).
00523                                                          NOTE: After MIX_CTL[EN]=0, the MIX will eventually
00524                                                          complete any "inflight" transactions, at which point the
00525                                                          BUSY will de-assert. */
00526     uint64_t en                           : 1;  /**< MIX Enable bit
00527                                                          When EN=0, MIX will no longer arbitrate for
00528                                                          any new L2/DRAM read/write requests on the NCB Bus.
00529                                                          MIX will complete any requests that are currently
00530                                                          pended for the NCB Bus. */
00531     uint64_t reset                        : 1;  /**< MIX Soft Reset
00532                                                           When SW writes a '1' to MIX_CTL[RESET], the
00533                                                           MII-MIX/AGL logic will execute a soft reset.
00534                                                           NOTE: During a soft reset, CSR accesses are not effected.
00535                                                           However, the values of the CSR fields will be effected by
00536                                                           soft reset (except MIX_CTL[RESET] itself).
00537                                                           NOTE: After power-on, the MII-AGL/MIX are held in reset
00538                                                           until the MIX_CTL[RESET] is written to zero. SW MUST also
00539                                                           perform a MIX_CTL CSR read after this write to ensure the
00540                                                           soft reset de-assertion has had sufficient time to propagate
00541                                                           to all MIO-MIX internal logic before any subsequent MIX CSR
00542                                                           accesses are issued.
00543                                                           The intended "soft reset" sequence is: (please also
00544                                                           refer to HRM Section 12.6.2 on MIX/AGL Block Reset).
00545                                                              1) Write MIX_CTL[EN]=0
00546                                                                 [To prevent any NEW transactions from being started]
00547                                                              2) Wait for MIX_CTL[BUSY]=0
00548                                                                 [To indicate that all inflight transactions have
00549                                                                  completed]
00550                                                              3) Write MIX_CTL[RESET]=1, followed by a MIX_CTL CSR read
00551                                                                 and wait for the result.
00552                                                              4) Re-Initialize the MIX/AGL just as would be done
00553                                                                 for a hard reset.
00554                                                          NOTE: Once the MII has been soft-reset, please refer to HRM Section
00555                                                          12.6.1 MIX/AGL BringUp Sequence to complete the MIX/AGL
00556                                                          re-initialization sequence. */
00557     uint64_t lendian                      : 1;  /**< Packet Little Endian Mode
00558                                                          (0: Big Endian Mode/1: Little Endian Mode)
00559                                                          When the mode is set, MIX will byte-swap packet data
00560                                                          loads/stores at the MIX/NCB boundary. */
00561     uint64_t nbtarb                       : 1;  /**< MIX CB-Request Arbitration Mode.
00562                                                          When set to zero, the arbiter is fixed priority with
00563                                                          the following priority scheme:
00564                                                              Highest Priority: I-Ring Packet Write Request
00565                                                                                O-Ring Packet Read Request
00566                                                                                I-Ring Entry Write Request
00567                                                                                I-Ring Entry Read Request
00568                                                                                O-Ring Entry Read Request
00569                                                          When set to one, the arbiter is round robin. */
00570     uint64_t mrq_hwm                      : 2;  /**< MIX CB-Request FIFO Programmable High Water Mark.
00571                                                          The MRQ contains 16 CB-Requests which are CSR Rd/Wr
00572                                                          Requests. If the MRQ backs up with "HWM" entries,
00573                                                          then new CB-Requests are 'stalled'.
00574                                                             [0]: HWM = 11
00575                                                             [1]: HWM = 10
00576                                                             [2]: HWM = 9
00577                                                             [3]: HWM = 8
00578                                                          NOTE: This must only be written at power-on/boot time. */
00579 #else
00580     uint64_t mrq_hwm                      : 2;
00581     uint64_t nbtarb                       : 1;
00582     uint64_t lendian                      : 1;
00583     uint64_t reset                        : 1;
00584     uint64_t en                           : 1;
00585     uint64_t busy                         : 1;
00586     uint64_t crc_strip                    : 1;
00587     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00588 #endif
00589     } cn52xx;
00590     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_cn52xx           cn52xxp1;
00591     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_cn52xx           cn56xx;
00592     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_cn52xx           cn56xxp1;
00593     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn61xx;
00594     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn63xx;
00595     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn63xxp1;
00596     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn66xx;
00597     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn68xx;
00598     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn68xxp1;
00599     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn73xx;
00600     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn78xx;
00601     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cn78xxp1;
00602     struct cvmx_mixx_ctl_s                cnf75xx;
00603 };
00604 typedef union cvmx_mixx_ctl cvmx_mixx_ctl_t;
00605 
00606 /**
00607  * cvmx_mix#_intena
00608  *
00609  * MIX_INTENA = MIX Local Interrupt Enable Mask Register
00610  *
00611  * Description:
00612  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_INTENA register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
00613  *        To read the MIX_INTENA register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
00614  */
00615 union cvmx_mixx_intena {
00616     uint64_t u64;
00617     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_s {
00618 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00619     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00620     uint64_t tsena                        : 1;  /**< TimeStamp Interrupt Enable
00621                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00622                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00623                                                          interrupt is reported for an Outbound Ring with Timestamp
00624                                                          event (see: MIX_ISR[TS]). */
00625     uint64_t orunena                      : 1;  /**< ORCNT UnderFlow Detected Enable
00626                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00627                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00628                                                          interrupt is reported for an ORCNT underflow condition
00629                                                          MIX_ISR[ORUN]. */
00630     uint64_t irunena                      : 1;  /**< IRCNT UnderFlow Interrupt Enable
00631                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00632                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00633                                                          interrupt is reported for an IRCNT underflow condition
00634                                                          MIX_ISR[IRUN]. */
00635     uint64_t data_drpena                  : 1;  /**< Data was dropped due to RX FIFO full Interrupt
00636                                                          enable. If both the global interrupt mask bits
00637                                                          (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII]) and the local interrupt mask
00638                                                          bit(DATA_DRPENA) is set, than an interrupt is
00639                                                          reported for this event. */
00640     uint64_t ithena                       : 1;  /**< Inbound Ring Threshold Exceeded Interrupt Enable
00641                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00642                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00643                                                          interrupt is reported for an Inbound Ring Threshold
00644                                                          Exceeded event(IRTHRESH). */
00645     uint64_t othena                       : 1;  /**< Outbound Ring Threshold Exceeded Interrupt Enable
00646                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00647                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00648                                                          interrupt is reported for an Outbound Ring Threshold
00649                                                          Exceeded event(ORTHRESH). */
00650     uint64_t ivfena                       : 1;  /**< Inbound DoorBell(IDBELL) Overflow Detected
00651                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00652                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00653                                                          interrupt is reported for an Inbound Doorbell Overflow
00654                                                          event(IDBOVF). */
00655     uint64_t ovfena                       : 1;  /**< Outbound DoorBell(ODBELL) Overflow Interrupt Enable
00656                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU2_EN_xx_yy_PKT[MII])
00657                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00658                                                          interrupt is reported for an Outbound Doorbell Overflow
00659                                                          event(ODBOVF). */
00660 #else
00661     uint64_t ovfena                       : 1;
00662     uint64_t ivfena                       : 1;
00663     uint64_t othena                       : 1;
00664     uint64_t ithena                       : 1;
00665     uint64_t data_drpena                  : 1;
00666     uint64_t irunena                      : 1;
00667     uint64_t orunena                      : 1;
00668     uint64_t tsena                        : 1;
00669     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00670 #endif
00671     } s;
00672     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_cn52xx {
00673 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00674     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
00675     uint64_t orunena                      : 1;  /**< ORCNT UnderFlow Detected
00676                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
00677                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00678                                                          interrupt is reported for an ORCNT underflow condition
00679                                                          MIX_ISR[ORUN]. */
00680     uint64_t irunena                      : 1;  /**< IRCNT UnderFlow Interrupt Enable
00681                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
00682                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00683                                                          interrupt is reported for an IRCNT underflow condition
00684                                                          MIX_ISR[IRUN]. */
00685     uint64_t data_drpena                  : 1;  /**< Data was dropped due to RX FIFO full Interrupt
00686                                                          enable. If both the global interrupt mask bits
00687                                                          (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII]) and the local interrupt mask
00688                                                          bit(DATA_DRPENA) is set, than an interrupt is
00689                                                          reported for this event. */
00690     uint64_t ithena                       : 1;  /**< Inbound Ring Threshold Exceeded Interrupt Enable
00691                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
00692                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00693                                                          interrupt is reported for an Inbound Ring Threshold
00694                                                          Exceeded event(IRTHRESH). */
00695     uint64_t othena                       : 1;  /**< Outbound Ring Threshold Exceeded Interrupt Enable
00696                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
00697                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00698                                                          interrupt is reported for an Outbound Ring Threshold
00699                                                          Exceeded event(ORTHRESH). */
00700     uint64_t ivfena                       : 1;  /**< Inbound DoorBell(IDBELL) Overflow Detected
00701                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
00702                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00703                                                          interrupt is reported for an Inbound Doorbell Overflow
00704                                                          event(IDBOVF). */
00705     uint64_t ovfena                       : 1;  /**< Outbound DoorBell(ODBELL) Overflow Interrupt Enable
00706                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
00707                                                          and this local interrupt mask bit is set, than an
00708                                                          interrupt is reported for an Outbound Doorbell Overflow
00709                                                          event(ODBOVF). */
00710 #else
00711     uint64_t ovfena                       : 1;
00712     uint64_t ivfena                       : 1;
00713     uint64_t othena                       : 1;
00714     uint64_t ithena                       : 1;
00715     uint64_t data_drpena                  : 1;
00716     uint64_t irunena                      : 1;
00717     uint64_t orunena                      : 1;
00718     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
00719 #endif
00720     } cn52xx;
00721     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_cn52xx        cn52xxp1;
00722     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_cn52xx        cn56xx;
00723     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_cn52xx        cn56xxp1;
00724     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_s             cn61xx;

00726     struct cvmx_mixx_intena_s             cn63xxp1;

00733 /**
00734  * cvmx_mix#_ircnt
00735  *
00736  * MIX_IRCNT = MIX I-Ring Pending Packet Counter
00737  *
00738  * Description:
00739  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_IRCNT register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
00740  *        To read the MIX_IRCNT register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
00741  */
00742 union cvmx_mixx_ircnt {
00743     uint64_t u64;
00744     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s {
00745 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00746     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
00747     uint64_t ircnt                        : 20; /**< Pending number of I-Ring packets.
00748                                                          Whenever hardware writes a completion code of DONE, TRUNC, CRCERR or ERR, it increments
00749                                                          the IRCNT (to indicate to software the number of pending Input packets in system memory).
00750                                                          The hardware guarantees that the completion code write is always visible in system memory
00751                                                          before it increments the IRCNT.
00752                                                          Reading IRCNT returns the current inbound packet count.
00753                                                          Writing IRCNT decrements the count by the value written.
00754                                                          This register is used to generate interrupts to alert software of pending inbound MIX
00755                                                          packets in system memory.
00756                                                          In the case of inbound packets that span multiple I-Ring entries, software must keep track
00757                                                          of the number of I-Ring Entries associated with a given inbound packet to reclaim the
00758                                                          proper number of I-Ring Entries for re-use. */
00759 #else
00760     uint64_t ircnt                        : 20;
00761     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
00762 #endif
00763     } s;
00764     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn52xx;
00765     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn52xxp1;
00766     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn56xx;
00767     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn56xxp1;
00768     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn61xx;
00769     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn63xx;
00770     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn63xxp1;
00771     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn66xx;
00772     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn68xx;
00773     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn68xxp1;
00774     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn73xx;
00775     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn78xx;
00776     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cn78xxp1;
00777     struct cvmx_mixx_ircnt_s              cnf75xx;
00778 };
00779 typedef union cvmx_mixx_ircnt cvmx_mixx_ircnt_t;

00781 /**
00782  * cvmx_mix#_irhwm
00783  *
00784  * MIX_IRHWM = MIX I-Ring High-Water Mark Threshold Register
00785  *
00786  * Description:
00787  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_IHWM register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
00788  *        To read the MIX_IHWM register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
00789  */
00790 union cvmx_mixx_irhwm {
00791     uint64_t u64;
00792     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s {
00793 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00794     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
00795     uint64_t ibplwm                       : 20; /**< I-Ring backpressure low-watermark threshold.
00796                                                          When the number of available I-Ring entries (IDBELL) is less than IBPLWM, the BGX-MAC does
00797                                                          the following:
00798                                                          * in full-duplex mode: send periodic PAUSE packets.
00799                                                          * in half-duplex mode: force collisions.
00800                                                          This programmable mechanism is provided as a means to backpressure input traffic early
00801                                                          enough so that packets are not dropped by CNXXXX. */
00802     uint64_t irhwm                        : 20; /**< I-Ring entry high-watermark threshold. Used to determine when the number of inbound
00803                                                          packets in system memory (MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT]) exceeds this IRHWM threshold. */
00804 #else
00805     uint64_t irhwm                        : 20;
00806     uint64_t ibplwm                       : 20;
00807     uint64_t reserved_40_63               : 24;
00808 #endif
00809     } s;
00810     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn52xx;
00811     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn52xxp1;
00812     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn56xx;
00813     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn56xxp1;
00814     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn61xx;
00815     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn63xx;
00816     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn63xxp1;
00817     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn66xx;
00818     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn68xx;
00819     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn68xxp1;
00820     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn73xx;
00821     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn78xx;
00822     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cn78xxp1;
00823     struct cvmx_mixx_irhwm_s              cnf75xx;
00824 };
00825 typedef union cvmx_mixx_irhwm cvmx_mixx_irhwm_t;

00827 /**

00831  *
00832  * Description:
00833  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_IRING1 register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
00834  *        To read the MIX_IRING1 register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
00835  */
00836 union cvmx_mixx_iring1 {
00837     uint64_t u64;
00838     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_s {
00839 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00840     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
00841 #else
00842     uint64_t reserved_0_63                : 64;
00843 #endif
00844     } s;
00845     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn52xx {
00846 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00847     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
00848     uint64_t isize                        : 20; /**< Represents the Inbound Ring Buffer's Size(in 8B
00849                                                          words). The ring can be as large as 1M entries.
00850                                                          NOTE: This CSR MUST BE setup written by SW poweron
00851                                                          (when IDBELL/IRCNT=0). */
00852     uint64_t reserved_36_39               : 4;
00853     uint64_t ibase                        : 33; /**< Represents the 8B-aligned base address of the first
00854                                                          Inbound Ring entry in system memory.
00855                                                          NOTE: SW MUST ONLY write to this register during
00856                                                          power-on/boot code. */
00857     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00858 #else
00859     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00860     uint64_t ibase                        : 33;
00861     uint64_t reserved_36_39               : 4;
00862     uint64_t isize                        : 20;
00863     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
00864 #endif
00865     } cn52xx;
00866     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn52xx        cn52xxp1;
00867     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn52xx        cn56xx;

00873                                                          words). The ring can be as large as 1M entries.
00874                                                          NOTE: This CSR MUST BE setup written by SW poweron
00875                                                          (when IDBELL/IRCNT=0). */
00876     uint64_t ibase                        : 37; /**< Represents the 8B-aligned base address of the first
00877                                                          Inbound Ring entry in system memory.
00878                                                          NOTE: SW MUST ONLY write to this register during
00879                                                          power-on/boot code. */
00880     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00881 #else
00882     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00883     uint64_t ibase                        : 37;
00884     uint64_t isize                        : 20;
00885     uint64_t reserved_60_63               : 4;
00886 #endif
00887     } cn61xx;
00888     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn61xx        cn63xx;
00889     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn61xx        cn63xxp1;

00891     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn61xx        cn68xx;
00892     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn61xx        cn68xxp1;
00893     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn73xx {
00894 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00895     uint64_t isize                        : 20; /**< Represents the inbound ring (I-Ring) buffer's size (in 8-byte words). The ring can be as
00896                                                          large as 1MB entries.
00897                                                          This CSR must be setup written by software poweron (when IDBELL/IRCNT=0). */
00898     uint64_t reserved_42_43               : 2;
00899     uint64_t ibase                        : 39; /**< Represents the 8-byte aligned base address of the first inbound ring
00900                                                          (I-Ring) entry in system memory.
00901                                                          Software must only write to this register during power-on/boot code. */
00902     uint64_t reserved_0_2                 : 3;
00903 #else

00905     uint64_t ibase                        : 39;

00908 #endif
00909     } cn73xx;
00910     struct cvmx_mixx_iring1_cn73xx        cn78xx;

00916 /**
00917  * cvmx_mix#_iring2
00918  *
00919  * MIX_IRING2 = MIX Inbound Ring Register \#2
00920  *
00921  * Description:
00922  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_IRING2 register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
00923  *        To read the MIX_IRING2 register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
00924  */
00925 union cvmx_mixx_iring2 {
00926     uint64_t u64;
00927     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s {
00928 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00929     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
00930     uint64_t itlptr                       : 20; /**< The inbound ring (I-Ring) tail pointer selects the I-Ring entry that the hardware will
00931                                                          process next. After the hardware completes receiving an inbound packet, it increments the
00932                                                          I-Ring tail pointer.
00933                                                          The I-Ring tail pointer hardware increment is always modulo MIX(0..1)_IRING2[ISIZE].
00934                                                          This field is read-only to software. */
00935     uint64_t reserved_20_31               : 12;
00936     uint64_t idbell                       : 20; /**< Represents the cumulative total of pending inbound ring (I-Ring) buffer entries. Each
00937                                                          I-Ring buffer entry contains an L2/DRAM byte pointer and a byte Length.
00938                                                          After software inserts a new entry into the I-Ring buffer, it 'rings the doorbell for the
00939                                                          inbound ring.' When the MIX hardware receives the doorbell ring, it advances the doorbell
00940                                                          count for the I-Ring.
00941                                                          Software must never cause the doorbell count for the I-Ring to exceed the size of
00942                                                          MIX(0..1)_IRING1[ISIZE]. A read of the CSR indicates the current doorbell count. */
00943 #else
00944     uint64_t idbell                       : 20;
00945     uint64_t reserved_20_31               : 12;
00946     uint64_t itlptr                       : 20;
00947     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
00948 #endif
00949     } s;
00950     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn52xx;
00951     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn52xxp1;
00952     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn56xx;
00953     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn56xxp1;
00954     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn61xx;
00955     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn63xx;
00956     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn63xxp1;
00957     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn66xx;
00958     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn68xx;
00959     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn68xxp1;
00960     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn73xx;
00961     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn78xx;
00962     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cn78xxp1;
00963     struct cvmx_mixx_iring2_s             cnf75xx;
00964 };
00965 typedef union cvmx_mixx_iring2 cvmx_mixx_iring2_t;

00967 /**
00968  * cvmx_mix#_isr
00969  *
00970  * This register provides a summary of the MIX interrupt bits.
00971  *
00972  */
00973 union cvmx_mixx_isr {
00974     uint64_t u64;
00975     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s {
00976 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00977     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
00978     uint64_t ts                           : 1;  /**< Timestamp interrupt. Throws MIX_INTSN_E:MIX(0..1)_INT_TS. This bit is set and the
00979                                                          interrupt generated when the number of pending timestamp interrupts
00980                                                          (MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT]) is greater than the timestamp interrupt threshold
00981                                                          (MIX(0..1)_CTL[TS_THRESH]) value. */
00982     uint64_t orun                         : 1;  /**< O-ring packet count underflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_ORUN. If
00983                                                          software writes a larger value than what is currently in the MIX(0..1)_ORCNT[ORCNT], then
00984                                                          hardware reports the underflow condition.
00985                                                          The MIX(0..1)_ORCNT[IOCNT] will clamp to zero.
00986                                                          If an ORUN underflow condition is detected, the integrity of the MIX hardware state has
00987                                                          been compromised. To recover, software must issue a software reset sequence. (See
00988                                                          MIX(0..1)_CTL[RESET.] */
00989     uint64_t irun                         : 1;  /**< I-ring packet count underflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_IRUN. If
00990                                                          software writes a larger value than what is currently in the MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT], then
00991                                                          hardware reports the underflow condition.
00992                                                          The MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT] will clamp to zero.
00993                                                          If an IRUN underflow condition is detected, the integrity of the MIX hardware state has
00994                                                          been compromised. To recover, software must issue a software reset sequence. (See
00995                                                          MIX(0..1)_CTL[RESET]). */
00996     uint64_t data_drp                     : 1;  /**< Data was dropped due to RX FIFO full. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_DATA_DRP. If this
00997                                                          event does occur, DATA_DRP is set and the interrupt is generated. */
00998     uint64_t irthresh                     : 1;  /**< Inbound ring packet threshold exceeded. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_IRTHRESH. When
00999                                                          the pending number of inbound packets in system memory (IRCNT) has exceeded a programmable
01000                                                          threshold (IRHWM), this bit is set and the interrupt is generated. To service this
01001                                                          interrupt, the IRCNT must first be lowered below the IRHWM before the W1C to this field. */
01002     uint64_t orthresh                     : 1;  /**< Outbound ring packet threshold exceeded. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_ORTHRESH. When
01003                                                          the pending number of outbound packets in system memory (ORCNT) has exceeded a
01004                                                          programmable threshold (ORHWM), this bit is set and the interrupt is generated. To service
01005                                                          this interrupt, the ORCNT must first be lowered below the ORHWM before the W1C to this
01006                                                          field. */
01007     uint64_t idblovf                      : 1;  /**< Inbound doorbell (IDBELL) overflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_IDBLOVF.
01008                                                          If software attempts to write to the MIX(0..1)_IRING2[IDBELL] with a value greater than
01009                                                          the remaining number of I-Ring buffer entries (MIX(0..1)_REMCNT[IREMCNT]), then the
01010                                                          following occurs:
01011                                                          * The MIX(0..1)_IRING2[IDBELL] write is IGNORED.
01012                                                          * [IDBLOVF] is set and the interrupt is generated.
01013                                                          Software should keep track of the number of I-Ring entries in use (i.e. the cumulative
01014                                                          number
01015                                                          of IDBELL write operations), and ensure that future IDBELL write operations don't exceed
01016                                                          the size of the I-Ring Buffer (MIX(0..1)_IRING2[ISIZE]). Software must reclaim I-Ring
01017                                                          entries by keeping track of the number of I-Ring entries, and writing to the
01018                                                          MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT].
01019                                                          The MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT] register represents the total number of packets (not I-Ring
01020                                                          entries) and software must further keep track of the number of I-Ring entries associated
01021                                                          with each packet as they are processed.
01022                                                          If an [IDBLOVF] occurs, it is an indication that software has overwritten the
01023                                                          I-Ring buffer, and the only recourse for recovery is a hardware reset. */
01024     uint64_t odblovf                      : 1;  /**< Outbound doorbell (ODBELL) overflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_ODBLOVF.
01025                                                          If software attempts to write to MIX(0..1)_ORING2[ODBELL] with a value greater than the
01026                                                          remaining number of O-Ring buffer entries (MIX(0..1)_REMCNT[OREMCNT]), then the following
01027                                                          occurs:
01028                                                          * The MIX(0..1)_IRING2[ODBELL] write operation is IGNORED.
01029                                                          * [ODBLOVF] is set and the interrupt is generated.
01030                                                          Software should keep track of the number of I-Ring entries in use (i.e. the cumulative
01031                                                          number of ODBELL write operations), and ensure that future ODBELL write operations don't
01032                                                          exceed the size of the O-Ring buffer (MIX(0..1)_ORING2[OSIZE]). Software must reclaim
01033                                                          O-Ring entries by writing to MIX(0..1)_ORCNT[ORCNT].
01034                                                          If an [ODBLOVF] occurs, it is an indication that software has overwritten the
01035                                                          O-Ring buffer, and the only recourse for recovery is a hardware reset. */
01036 #else
01037     uint64_t odblovf                      : 1;
01038     uint64_t idblovf                      : 1;
01039     uint64_t orthresh                     : 1;
01040     uint64_t irthresh                     : 1;
01041     uint64_t data_drp                     : 1;
01042     uint64_t irun                         : 1;
01043     uint64_t orun                         : 1;
01044     uint64_t ts                           : 1;
01045     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01046 #endif
01047     } s;
01048     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_cn52xx {
01049 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01050     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
01051     uint64_t orun                         : 1;  /**< ORCNT UnderFlow Detected
01052                                                          If SW writes a larger value than what is currently
01053                                                          in the MIX_ORCNT[ORCNT], then HW will report the
01054                                                          underflow condition.
01055                                                          NOTE: The MIX_ORCNT[IOCNT] will clamp to to zero.
01056                                                          NOTE: If an ORUN underflow condition is detected,
01057                                                          the integrity of the MIX/AGL HW state has
01058                                                          been compromised. To recover, SW must issue a
01059                                                          software reset sequence (see: MIX_CTL[RESET] */
01060     uint64_t irun                         : 1;  /**< IRCNT UnderFlow Detected
01061                                                          If SW writes a larger value than what is currently
01062                                                          in the MIX_IRCNT[IRCNT], then HW will report the
01063                                                          underflow condition.
01064                                                          NOTE: The MIX_IRCNT[IRCNT] will clamp to to zero.
01065                                                          NOTE: If an IRUN underflow condition is detected,
01066                                                          the integrity of the MIX/AGL HW state has
01067                                                          been compromised. To recover, SW must issue a
01068                                                          software reset sequence (see: MIX_CTL[RESET] */
01069     uint64_t data_drp                     : 1;  /**< Data was dropped due to RX FIFO full
01070                                                          If this does occur, the DATA_DRP is set and the
01071                                                          CIU_INTx_SUM0,4[MII] bits are set.
01072                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
01073                                                          and the local interrupt mask bit(DATA_DRPENA) is set, than an
01074                                                          interrupt is reported for this event. */
01075     uint64_t irthresh                     : 1;  /**< Inbound Ring Packet Threshold Exceeded
01076                                                          When the pending \#inbound packets in system
01077                                                          memory(IRCNT) has exceeded a programmable threshold
01078                                                          (IRHWM), then this bit is set. If this does occur,
01079                                                          the IRTHRESH is set and the CIU_INTx_SUM0,4[MII] bits
01080                                                          are set if ((MIX_ISR & MIX_INTENA) != 0)).
01081                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
01082                                                          and the local interrupt mask bit(ITHENA) is set, than an
01083                                                          interrupt is reported for this event. */
01084     uint64_t orthresh                     : 1;  /**< Outbound Ring Packet Threshold Exceeded
01085                                                          When the pending \#outbound packets in system
01086                                                          memory(ORCNT) has exceeded a programmable threshold
01087                                                          (ORHWM), then this bit is set. If this does occur,
01088                                                          the ORTHRESH is set and the CIU_INTx_SUM0,4[MII] bits
01089                                                          are set if ((MIX_ISR & MIX_INTENA) != 0)).
01090                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
01091                                                          and the local interrupt mask bit(OTHENA) is set, than an
01092                                                          interrupt is reported for this event. */
01093     uint64_t idblovf                      : 1;  /**< Inbound DoorBell(IDBELL) Overflow Detected
01094                                                          If SW attempts to write to the MIX_IRING2[IDBELL]
01095                                                          with a value greater than the remaining \#of
01096                                                          I-Ring Buffer Entries (MIX_REMCNT[IREMCNT]), then
01097                                                          the following occurs:
01098                                                          1) The  MIX_IRING2[IDBELL] write is IGNORED
01099                                                          2) The ODBLOVF is set and the CIU_INTx_SUM0,4[MII]
01100                                                             bits are set if ((MIX_ISR & MIX_INTENA) != 0)).
01101                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
01102                                                          and the local interrupt mask bit(IVFENA) is set, than an
01103                                                          interrupt is reported for this event.
01104                                                          SW should keep track of the \#I-Ring Entries in use
01105                                                          (ie: cumulative \# of IDBELL writes),  and ensure that
01106                                                          future IDBELL writes don't exceed the size of the
01107                                                          I-Ring Buffer (MIX_IRING2[ISIZE]).
01108                                                          SW must reclaim I-Ring Entries by keeping track of the
01109                                                          \#IRing-Entries, and writing to the MIX_IRCNT[IRCNT].
01110                                                          NOTE: The MIX_IRCNT[IRCNT] register represents the
01111                                                          total \#packets(not IRing Entries) and SW must further
01112                                                          keep track of the \# of I-Ring Entries associated with
01113                                                          each packet as they are processed.
01114                                                          NOTE: There is no recovery from an IDBLOVF Interrupt.
01115                                                          If it occurs, it's an indication that SW has
01116                                                          overwritten the I-Ring buffer, and the only recourse
01117                                                          is a HW reset. */
01118     uint64_t odblovf                      : 1;  /**< Outbound DoorBell(ODBELL) Overflow Detected
01119                                                          If SW attempts to write to the MIX_ORING2[ODBELL]
01120                                                          with a value greater than the remaining \#of
01121                                                          O-Ring Buffer Entries (MIX_REMCNT[OREMCNT]), then
01122                                                          the following occurs:
01123                                                          1) The  MIX_ORING2[ODBELL] write is IGNORED
01124                                                          2) The ODBLOVF is set and the CIU_INTx_SUM0,4[MII]
01125                                                             bits are set if ((MIX_ISR & MIX_INTENA) != 0)).
01126                                                          If both the global interrupt mask bits (CIU_INTx_EN*[MII])
01127                                                          and the local interrupt mask bit(OVFENA) is set, than an
01128                                                          interrupt is reported for this event.
01129                                                          SW should keep track of the \#I-Ring Entries in use
01130                                                          (ie: cumulative \# of ODBELL writes),  and ensure that
01131                                                          future ODBELL writes don't exceed the size of the
01132                                                          O-Ring Buffer (MIX_ORING2[OSIZE]).
01133                                                          SW must reclaim O-Ring Entries by writing to the
01134                                                          MIX_ORCNT[ORCNT]. .
01135                                                          NOTE: There is no recovery from an ODBLOVF Interrupt.
01136                                                          If it occurs, it's an indication that SW has
01137                                                          overwritten the O-Ring buffer, and the only recourse
01138                                                          is a HW reset. */
01139 #else
01140     uint64_t odblovf                      : 1;
01141     uint64_t idblovf                      : 1;
01142     uint64_t orthresh                     : 1;
01143     uint64_t irthresh                     : 1;
01144     uint64_t data_drp                     : 1;
01145     uint64_t irun                         : 1;
01146     uint64_t orun                         : 1;
01147     uint64_t reserved_7_63                : 57;
01148 #endif
01149     } cn52xx;
01150     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_cn52xx           cn52xxp1;
01151     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_cn52xx           cn56xx;
01152     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_cn52xx           cn56xxp1;
01153     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn61xx;
01154     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn63xx;
01155     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn63xxp1;
01156     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn66xx;
01157     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn68xx;
01158     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn68xxp1;
01159     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn73xx;
01160     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn78xx;
01161     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cn78xxp1;
01162     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_s                cnf75xx;
01163 };
01164 typedef union cvmx_mixx_isr cvmx_mixx_isr_t;
01165 
01166 /**
01167  * cvmx_mix#_isr_w1s
01168  */
01169 union cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s {
01170     uint64_t u64;
01171     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s_s {
01172 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01173     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01174     uint64_t ts                           : 1;  /**< Timestamp interrupt. Throws MIX_INTSN_E:MIX(0..1)_INT_TS. This bit is set and the
01175                                                          interrupt generated when the number of pending timestamp interrupts
01176                                                          (MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT]) is greater than the timestamp interrupt threshold
01177                                                          (MIX(0..1)_CTL[TS_THRESH]) value. */
01178     uint64_t orun                         : 1;  /**< O-ring packet count underflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_ORUN. If
01179                                                          software writes a larger value than what is currently in the MIX(0..1)_ORCNT[ORCNT], then
01180                                                          hardware reports the underflow condition.
01181                                                          The MIX(0..1)_ORCNT[IOCNT] will clamp to zero.
01182                                                          If an ORUN underflow condition is detected, the integrity of the MIX hardware state has
01183                                                          been compromised. To recover, software must issue a software reset sequence. (See
01184                                                          MIX(0..1)_CTL[RESET.] */
01185     uint64_t irun                         : 1;  /**< I-ring packet count underflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_IRUN. If
01186                                                          software writes a larger value than what is currently in the MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT], then
01187                                                          hardware reports the underflow condition.
01188                                                          The MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT] will clamp to zero.
01189                                                          If an IRUN underflow condition is detected, the integrity of the MIX hardware state has
01190                                                          been compromised. To recover, software must issue a software reset sequence. (See
01191                                                          MIX(0..1)_CTL[RESET]). */
01192     uint64_t data_drp                     : 1;  /**< Data was dropped due to RX FIFO full. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_DATA_DRP. If this
01193                                                          event does occur, DATA_DRP is set and the interrupt is generated. */
01194     uint64_t irthresh                     : 1;  /**< Inbound ring packet threshold exceeded. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_IRTHRESH. When
01195                                                          the pending number of inbound packets in system memory (IRCNT) has exceeded a programmable
01196                                                          threshold (IRHWM), this bit is set and the interrupt is generated. To service this
01197                                                          interrupt, the IRCNT must first be lowered below the IRHWM before the W1C to this field. */
01198     uint64_t orthresh                     : 1;  /**< Outbound ring packet threshold exceeded. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_ORTHRESH. When
01199                                                          the pending number of outbound packets in system memory (ORCNT) has exceeded a
01200                                                          programmable threshold (ORHWM), this bit is set and the interrupt is generated. To service
01201                                                          this interrupt, the ORCNT must first be lowered below the ORHWM before the W1C to this
01202                                                          field. */
01203     uint64_t idblovf                      : 1;  /**< Inbound doorbell (IDBELL) overflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_IDBLOVF.
01204                                                          If software attempts to write to the MIX(0..1)_IRING2[IDBELL] with a value greater than
01205                                                          the remaining number of I-Ring buffer entries (MIX(0..1)_REMCNT[IREMCNT]), then the
01206                                                          following occurs:
01207                                                          * The MIX(0..1)_IRING2[IDBELL] write is IGNORED.
01208                                                          * [IDBLOVF] is set and the interrupt is generated.
01209                                                          Software should keep track of the number of I-Ring entries in use (i.e. the cumulative
01210                                                          number
01211                                                          of IDBELL write operations), and ensure that future IDBELL write operations don't exceed
01212                                                          the size of the I-Ring Buffer (MIX(0..1)_IRING2[ISIZE]). Software must reclaim I-Ring
01213                                                          entries by keeping track of the number of I-Ring entries, and writing to the
01214                                                          MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT].
01215                                                          The MIX(0..1)_IRCNT[IRCNT] register represents the total number of packets (not I-Ring
01216                                                          entries) and software must further keep track of the number of I-Ring entries associated
01217                                                          with each packet as they are processed.
01218                                                          If an [IDBLOVF] occurs, it is an indication that software has overwritten the
01219                                                          I-Ring buffer, and the only recourse for recovery is a hardware reset. */
01220     uint64_t odblovf                      : 1;  /**< Outbound doorbell (ODBELL) overflow detected. Throws MIX_INTSN_E::MIX(0..1)_INT_ODBLOVF.
01221                                                          If software attempts to write to MIX(0..1)_ORING2[ODBELL] with a value greater than the
01222                                                          remaining number of O-Ring buffer entries (MIX(0..1)_REMCNT[OREMCNT]), then the following
01223                                                          occurs:
01224                                                          * The MIX(0..1)_IRING2[ODBELL] write operation is IGNORED.
01225                                                          * [ODBLOVF] is set and the interrupt is generated.
01226                                                          Software should keep track of the number of I-Ring entries in use (i.e. the cumulative
01227                                                          number of ODBELL write operations), and ensure that future ODBELL write operations don't
01228                                                          exceed the size of the O-Ring buffer (MIX(0..1)_ORING2[OSIZE]). Software must reclaim
01229                                                          O-Ring entries by writing to MIX(0..1)_ORCNT[ORCNT].
01230                                                          If an [ODBLOVF] occurs, it is an indication that software has overwritten the
01231                                                          O-Ring buffer, and the only recourse for recovery is a hardware reset. */
01232 #else
01233     uint64_t odblovf                      : 1;
01234     uint64_t idblovf                      : 1;
01235     uint64_t orthresh                     : 1;
01236     uint64_t irthresh                     : 1;
01237     uint64_t data_drp                     : 1;
01238     uint64_t irun                         : 1;
01239     uint64_t orun                         : 1;
01240     uint64_t ts                           : 1;
01241     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
01242 #endif
01243     } s;
01244     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s_s            cn73xx;
01245     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s_s            cn78xx;
01246     struct cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s_s            cnf75xx;
01247 };
01248 typedef union cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s cvmx_mixx_isr_w1s_t;

01250 /**
01251  * cvmx_mix#_orcnt
01252  *
01253  * MIX_ORCNT = MIX O-Ring Packets Sent Counter
01254  *
01255  * Description:
01256  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_ORCNT register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
01257  *        To read the MIX_ORCNT register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
01258  */
01259 union cvmx_mixx_orcnt {
01260     uint64_t u64;
01261     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s {
01262 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01263     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
01264     uint64_t orcnt                        : 20; /**< Pending number of O-Ring packets.
01265                                                          Whenever hardware removes a packet from the O-Ring, it increments the ORCNT (to indicate
01266                                                          to software the number of Output packets in system memory that can be reclaimed).
01267                                                          Reading ORCNT returns the current count.
01268                                                          Writing ORCNT decrements the count by the value written.
01269                                                          This register is used to generate interrupts to alert software of pending outbound MIX
01270                                                          packets that have been removed from system memory. (See MIX(0..1)_ISR[ORTHRESH]
01271                                                          description for more details.)
01272                                                          For outbound packets, the number of O-Ring packets is equal to the number of O-Ring
01273                                                          Entries. */
01274 #else
01275     uint64_t orcnt                        : 20;
01276     uint64_t reserved_20_63               : 44;
01277 #endif
01278     } s;
01279     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn52xx;
01280     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn52xxp1;
01281     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn56xx;
01282     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn56xxp1;
01283     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn61xx;
01284     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn63xx;
01285     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn63xxp1;
01286     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn66xx;
01287     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn68xx;
01288     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn68xxp1;
01289     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn73xx;
01290     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn78xx;
01291     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cn78xxp1;
01292     struct cvmx_mixx_orcnt_s              cnf75xx;
01293 };

01424 /**
01425  * cvmx_mix#_oring2
01426  *
01427  * MIX_ORING2 = MIX Outbound Ring Register \#2
01428  *
01429  * Description:
01430  *  NOTE: To write to the MIX_ORING2 register, a device would issue an IOBST directed at the MIO.
01431  *        To read the MIX_ORING2 register, a device would issue an IOBLD64 directed at the MIO.
01432  */
01433 union cvmx_mixx_oring2 {
01434     uint64_t u64;
01435     struct cvmx_mixx_oring2_s {
01436 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01437     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
01438     uint64_t otlptr                       : 20; /**< The outbound ring tail pointer selects the O-Ring entry that the hardware will process
01439                                                          next. After the hardware completes sending an outbound packet, it increments the O-Ring
01440                                                          tail pointer.
01441                                                          The O-Ring tail pointer hardware increment is always modulo MIX(0..1)_ORING2[OSIZE].
01442                                                          This field is read-only to software. */
01443     uint64_t reserved_20_31               : 12;
01444     uint64_t odbell                       : 20; /**< Represents the cumulative total of pending outbound ring (O-Ring) buffer entries. Each
01445                                                          O-Ring buffer entry contains an L2/DRAM byte pointer and a byte length.
01446                                                          After software inserts new entries into the O-Ring buffer, it 'rings the doorbell with the
01447                                                          count of the newly inserted entries.' When the MIX hardware receives the doorbell ring, it
01448                                                          increments the current doorbell count by the CSR write value.
01449                                                          Software must never cause the doorbell count for the O-Ring to exceed the size of
01450                                                          MIX(0..1)_ORING1[OSIZE]. A read of the CSR indicates the current doorbell count. */
01451 #else
01452     uint64_t odbell                       : 20;
01453     uint64_t reserved_20_31               : 12;
01454     uint64_t otlptr                       : 20;
01455     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
01456 #endif
01457     } s;
