01475 /**
01476  * cvmx_mix#_remcnt
01477  *
01478  * This register contains the MIX ring buffer remainder counts (useful for hardware debug only).
01479  *
01480  */
01481 union cvmx_mixx_remcnt {
01482     uint64_t u64;
01483     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s {
01484 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01485     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
01486     uint64_t iremcnt                      : 20; /**< Remaining I-Ring buffer count. Reflects the number of unused/remaining I-Ring entries that
01487                                                          hardware currently detects in the I-Ring buffer. Hardware uses this value to detect I-Ring
01488                                                          doorbell overflows. (See MIX(0..1)_ISR[IDBLOVF].)
01489                                                          When software writes the MIX(0..1)_IRING1[ISIZE], [IREMCNT] is loaded with the
01490                                                          MIX(0..1)_IRING2[ISIZE] value. (Note: ISIZE should only be written at power-on, when it is
01491                                                          known that there are no I-Ring entries currently in use by hardware.) When software writes
01492                                                          to the IDBELL register, the [IREMCNT] is decremented by the CSR write value. When hardware
01493                                                          issues an I-Ring write request (onto the IOI), REMCNT is incremented by 1. */
01494     uint64_t reserved_20_31               : 12;
01495     uint64_t oremcnt                      : 20; /**< Remaining O-Ring buffer count. Reflects the number of unused/remaining O-Ring entries that
01496                                                          hardware currently detects in the O-Ring buffer. Hardware uses this value to detect O-Ring
01497                                                          doorbell overflows. (See MIX(0..1)_ISR[ODBLOVF].)
01498                                                          When software writes the MIX(0..1)_ORING1[OSIZE], [OREMCNT] is loaded with the
01499                                                          MIX(0..1)_ORING2[OSIZE] value. (Note: [OSIZE] should only be written at power-on, when it
01500                                                          is known that no O-Ring entries are currently in use by hardware.) When software writes to
01501                                                          the ODBELL register, OREMCNT is decremented by the CSR write value. When software writes
01502                                                          to [OREMCNT], it is decremented by the CSR write value. */
01503 #else
01504     uint64_t oremcnt                      : 20;
01505     uint64_t reserved_20_31               : 12;
01506     uint64_t iremcnt                      : 20;
01507     uint64_t reserved_52_63               : 12;
01508 #endif
01509     } s;
01510     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn52xx;
01511     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn52xxp1;
01512     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn56xx;
01513     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn56xxp1;
01514     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn61xx;
01515     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn63xx;
01516     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn63xxp1;
01517     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn66xx;
01518     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn68xx;
01519     struct cvmx_mixx_remcnt_s             cn68xxp1;

01526 
01527 /**
01528  * cvmx_mix#_tsctl
01529  *
01530  * This register contains the control fields for MIX timestamps. Software can read this register
01531  * to determine the number pending timestamp interrupts ([TSCNT]), the number outstanding
01532  * timestamp requests in flight ([TSTOT]), and the number of available timestamp entries (TSAVL)
01533  * in the timestamp FIFO.
01534  *
01535  * Writing to this register advances the MIX(0..1)_TSTAMP FIFO head pointer by 1 and decrements
01536  * the [TSCNT, TSTOT] pending counts by 1. For example, if software reads [TSCNT] = 2 (two
01537  * pending timestamp interrupts), it would immediately issue this sequence:
01538  *
01539  * 1. a MIX(0..1)_TSTAMP[TSTAMP] read operation followed by MIX(0..1)_TSCTL write operation (i.e.
01540  * it
01541  * gets the timestamp value, pops the timestamp FIFO, and decrements pending counts by 1).
01542  *
01543  * 2. a MIX(0..1)_TSTAMP[TSTAMP] read operation followed by MIX(0..1)_TSCTL write operation.
01544  *
01545  * Note for software: A MIX(0..1)_TSCTL write operation is ignored when
01546  * MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT] = 0 (i.e., TimeStamp FIFO empty).
01547  */
01548 union cvmx_mixx_tsctl {
01549     uint64_t u64;
01550     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s {
01551 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01552     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
01553     uint64_t tsavl                        : 5;  /**< Number of MIX timestamp entries available for use. [TSAVL] MAX = 4
01554                                                          (implementation depth of timestamp FIFO).
01555                                                          [TSAVL] = (IMPLEMENTATION_DEPTH = 4(MAX) - TSCNT). */
01556     uint64_t reserved_13_15               : 3;
01557     uint64_t tstot                        : 5;  /**< Number of pending MIX timestamp requests in flight. [TSTOT] must never exceed MAX = 4
01558                                                          (implementation depth of timestamp FIFO). */
01559     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
01560     uint64_t tscnt                        : 5;  /**< Number of pending MIX timestamp interrupts. [TSCNT] must never exceed MAX=4
01561                                                          (implementation depth of timestamp FIFO). */
01562 #else
01563     uint64_t tscnt                        : 5;
01564     uint64_t reserved_5_7                 : 3;
01565     uint64_t tstot                        : 5;
01566     uint64_t reserved_13_15               : 3;
01567     uint64_t tsavl                        : 5;
01568     uint64_t reserved_21_63               : 43;
01569 #endif
01570     } s;
01571     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s              cn61xx;
01572     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s              cn63xx;
01573     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s              cn63xxp1;
01574     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s              cn66xx;
01575     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s              cn68xx;
01576     struct cvmx_mixx_tsctl_s              cn68xxp1;

01584 /**
01585  * cvmx_mix#_tstamp
01586  *
01587  * This register contains the MIX timestamp value.
01588  *
01589  */
01590 union cvmx_mixx_tstamp {
01591     uint64_t u64;
01592     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s {
01593 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01594     uint64_t tstamp                       : 64; /**< MIX timestamp value. When software sets up an O-Ring entry with
01595                                                          [49] = 1 (TSTAMP), the packet is tagged with a special 'SOP with TSTAMP' flag as it is
01596                                                          sent to the BGX. Later the BGX sends sample strobe(s) to capture a global 64-bit timestamp
01597                                                          value, followed by a 'commit' strobe which writes the last sampled value into the outbound
01598                                                          timestamp FIFO (max depth = 4) and increments
01599                                                          MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT] to indicate the total number of pending timestamp interrupts.
01600                                                          If the number of pending timestamp interrupts (MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT]) is greater than the
01601                                                          MIX(0..1)_CTL[TS_THRESH] value, then a programmable interrupt is also triggered (see
01602                                                          MIX(0..1)_ISR[TS].
01603                                                          Software then reads MIX(0..1)_TSTAMP[TSTAMP], and must then write MIX(0..1)_TSCTL, which
01604                                                          will decrement MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT] to indicate that a single timestamp interrupt has
01605                                                          been serviced.
01606                                                          The MIO-MIX hardware tracks up to MAX = 4 outstanding timestamped outbound packets at a
01607                                                          time. All subsequent O-RING entries with SOP-TSTAMP will be stalled until software can
01608                                                          service the 4 outstanding interrupts. Software can read
01609                                                          MIX(0..1)_TSCTL to determine the number of pending timestamp interrupts (TSCNT), plus the
01610                                                          number of outstanding timestamp requests in flight (TSTOT), as well as the number of
01611                                                          available timestamp entries (TSAVL).
01612                                                          A MIX_TSTAMP read when
01613                                                          MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT] = 0 will result in a return value of all zeroes. Software should
01614                                                          only read this register when
01615                                                          MIX(0..1)_ISR[TS] = 1 (or when MIX(0..1)_TSCTL[TSCNT] != 0) to retrieve the timestamp
01616                                                          value recorded by hardware. If software reads the [TSTAMP] when hardware has not
01617                                                          recorded a valid timestamp, then an all zeroes value is returned. */
01618 #else
01619     uint64_t tstamp                       : 64;
01620 #endif
01621     } s;
01622     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn61xx;
01623     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn63xx;
01624     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn63xxp1;
01625     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn66xx;
01626     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn68xx;
01627     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn68xxp1;
01628     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn73xx;
01629     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn78xx;
01630     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cn78xxp1;
01631     struct cvmx_mixx_tstamp_s             cnf75xx;
01632 };
